medium: Black chalk with brown wash and white gouache
creditline: Museum purchase, gift of Mrs. George L. Craig Jr., in memory of her husband, Class of 1921
signed: Inscribed, dated, and signed in white ink, lower right: Rome 1817. T. Gericault

texts.textentryhtml: Probably Faivre Dusser (his sale, Paris, Hotel Drouot, Vente M.D., January 27, 1870, lot 18 [as “Nymph et satyre,” no dimensions]); General Louis Bro; Colonel Olivier Bro de Comeres; Blot Collection; [the last three owners supplied by dealer]; viz. L. Eitner 1983, p. 335, note 25: “…said to be from the Bro de Comeres collection”]; Coll. Wildenstein, N.Y.;

caption: Théodore Géricault (French, 1791–1824), Satyr and Nymph, 1817. Black chalk with brown wash and white gouache; 22.2 x 18.2 cm. Museum purchase, gift of Mrs. George L. Craig Jr., in memory of her husband, Class of 1921 (x1986-19)
